item.name: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
item.comment: Truly excellent game! Combines the elegance of a Euro with the style of Ameritrash. Brilliant mechanics make this one a winner I'll want to play again and again.

item.name: Age of Mythology: The Boardgame
item.comment: Simplifies the empire-building style that I like by eliminating all the movement aspects and allowing each player only one action per turn. Everyone I know loves this game, though the rules can be a little bit daunting for some.

item.name: Angel: The Board Game
item.comment: Ties with Killer Bunnies as being one of the worst games I've ever played (Killer Bunnies is probably marginally better, even if only due to the fact that at least the theme ties in with the mechanics more and it was actually trying to be an original, interesting *game*). Imagine Ludo with a few extra, unnecessary rules thrown in to its detriment and a stupid memory game mechanic tacked on for bad measure. How did this piece of dross ever get to be associated with the Angel licence? Awful, awful, awful.

item.name: The Ark of the Covenant
item.comment: The main reason I rate this so low is: why would I ever play this instead of Carcassonne?

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: Masses of theme which make this game very enjoyable - like a role-playing game in board game form. A few tweaks are required to get the best out of the game (see StormKnight's variant as a starting point) and definitely needs to be played with the right people. Grows on me more and more every time I play.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion
item.comment: Just adds more cards to the base set.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Dunwich Horror Expansion
item.comment: Just like the original but "more" and harder to complete.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
item.comment: Adds a little more difficulty and tension to the game.

item.name: Atmosfear: The DVD Board Game
item.comment: Fun, simple game for use as an opener or in a party-type atmosphere (pardon the pun). A few of the cards show that they haven't quite been thought through properly, and the gameplay (and interaction with the DVD) could have been a little more interesting, but otherwise "okay".

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: Fun little filler card game with two drawbacks - one minor, one major. Minor: special powers of cards are not written on the cards themselves so you must consult the rulebook (the same problem as with Family Business, only not quite so bad). Major: player elimination.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Big Brother: The Game
item.comment: Own the British version. Despite the other negative reviews here, I must say I really like this game and consider it one of my favourite party games. It's a ton of fun, precisely because you *can* have a good time slagging off your friends while they're all there with you! The only two drawbacks are that you have to play with at least five people who all know each other reasonably well and, more importantly, are all emotionally stable and secure. Recreates the feel and atmosphere of the TV show really well, especially if you're the first one to be kicked out of the house! Highly recommended if you can cope with it.

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment: Bought this game with one expansion, played six games immediately (one for each combination of each race combating with each player) but loved it straight away. Have been looking for a good, easy to pick up 2-player game for a long while and think this may be it. Gonna be played often, and I think will get even better with more expansions. Another gem from Reiner!

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment: Very easy to pick up, with good strategy and short playing time. Only really "clicked" with me after the fifth playing, though. Another solid Knizia.

item.name: Blue Moon: The Aqua
item.comment: Certainly don't seem as powerful as the other races though I think this may be due to a different play style being needed for them. Am eager to try again.

item.name: Blue Moon: The Mimix
item.comment: A more difficult deck to play than the others, but if you can put the effort in it might be quite interesting.

item.name: Blue Moon: The Pillar
item.comment: Interesting deck that seems quite powerful.

item.name: Blue Moon: The Terrah
item.comment: I rate this lower than the base game just because the Terrah are the race out of the three decks I've bought so far that I like the least - they just seem a bit less interesting than the Vulca or Hoax, and concentrate on *stopping* things from happening. Not as fond of the artwork either!

item.name: BN1: A Board Game All About Brighton
Boggle
item.comment: Word games are just not my thing.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Have a feeling I didn't really "get" this game, especially as everyone else seems to rate it so high. Only played once, but felt like I didn't have very much control over what I was doing.

item.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Board Game
item.comment: Although I like this game very much, you really need exactly eight players in order to play it (which doesn't happen very often). Although it has some flaws (most notible of which are a lack of rules prohibiting players from sharing their information), I like to think of it as a superior version of Cluedo.

item.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Game
Byzantium
item.comment: Good game, but in the two games played so far I'm seeing a couple of broken mechanics. Nothing major, so hopefully repeated playings will iron them out.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: A classic. Only rate it lower than an 8 'cos I've played it so often and got a little bit sick of it!

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 1 – Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment: Same as the original - makes it neither better nor worse, just different.

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 2 – Traders & Builders
item.comment: Best of the expansions I've played so far - adds a lot of strategic decision-making to the game without making it too complicated.

item.name: Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers
item.comment: Almost exactly the same as the original, but I don't find it quite so "catchy" for some reason. Just might as well play the original, I guess, with all the expansions available!

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: Prefer this to the original; of course - Reiner Knizia!

item.name: Carcassonne: The City
item.comment: Think I still slightly prefer the original if it has a few expansions added, but this is definitely superior to the base game by far. Much more strategical thinking needed and works much better as a stand-alone game with it's own self-contained rules.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River
item.comment: Same as the original - makes it neither better nor worse, just different.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Seminal game - all that can be said.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World: The Horned Rat Expansion
Chronology
item.comment: Very light, easy game to pick up. Always good to start off a gaming session to warm up. Bonus: though it's a game about history, very little historical knowledge required!

item.name: Citadels: The Dark City
item.comment: As good as the original.

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: I played Galaxy: The Dark Ages first so I prefer that, but I can see why many people prefer the simplicity of this one. Yet another excellent game from the good Doctor.

item.name: Cranium
item.comment: For me, the best party game - combines elements of all other party games so you don't have to decide! Definitely only good with the right people, though (i.e - fun people)!

item.name: Crystal Maze
item.comment: Just a load of puzzles and dexterity toys (you know the ones - try to get the little metal ball into the hole sort of things) packaged in a (very) big box. It was a jolly little game when I was 12, not so much any more. Board is very pretty, though.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Deadlands: The Battle for Slaughter Gulch
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Excellent "starbase-crawler" game. Captures the feel of the computer game very well and really creates the feeling of struggling to just get out alive. Replaced Space Crusade in my collection.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame Expansion Set
item.comment: Adds more monsters and generally more options to the original. Only (very) minor gripe is that adding more types of monsters makes it more difficult to remember their stats off the top of your head, but that's about it. Otherwise, very good.

item.name: Drakon (third edition)
item.comment: After a few plays am starting to see the strategy in it. Only plays well with 4 people. Good, (extremely) light, fun dungeon-crawler.

item.name: Dream Factory
item.comment: One of my favourite Knizia bidding games. Similar to Ra, but I much prefer this as you get a constant supply of "money" coming in (rather than having to wait until the next round) and you can see what auction items are coming up in advance, allowing for a little more strategic planning.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
Elfenland
item.comment:
Have played only twice - once with four players, once with two players. Two-player game was a bit dull due to neither player taking the same route, so ended up being 2-player solitaire. Four-player game died for the same reason, but not sure why! I'm sure this is a much better game than I think it is, but maybe I need to try it with six (though I'm not fond of games that require a high number players to play - or at least play with *fun*).
Edit: Played again with three and it went much better this time, mostly because we all headed in the same direction. Have upped score slightly accordingly but will need to play more to make sure.
Re-redit: DEFINITELY best with six.

item.name: Elixir
item.comment: Nice little game, good to play if you want something fun and unchallenging. Usually play with hardened non-gamers!

item.name: En Garde!
item.comment: A complete "take that" game but very fun. Recreates the mood of a duel quite well for something so simple, surprisingly!

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Family Business
item.comment: Completely random game with the annoying design flaw that none of the card abilities are printed on the cards themselves! You have to look each card up in the rulebook to figure out what it does!

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: Not really a game - cards have completely random, bizarre effects so it's completely impossible to have any strategy. This game is just if you want to have a laugh and scream a bit. Fun if it's with the right people.

item.name: Freight Train
item.comment: Not a bad game, but not particularly interesting. Exceptionally dull theme.

item.name: Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment: A quite light-ish game that's good fun. Our first game was a bit too short to evaluate properly, but I can certainly see there's potential!

item.name: Galaxy: The Dark Ages
item.comment: An excellent game, with plenty of good strategy and a theme I love. The main reason this game loses a point, though, is the difficult to understand rulebook - seems to explain the rules backwards and doesn't flow well. Apart from that, one of my faves!

item.name: Game of the Year
item.comment: Crappy game of the Game of Life style. Only rate the gameplay weight as light/medium due to lots of fiddly exceptions in the rules of what otherwise should be a very simple game.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: A Clash of Kings Expansion
A Game of Thrones: A Storm of Swords Expansion
Game of Thrones: The Card Game
HeroQuest
item.comment: Loved this game when I was a kid, but realise now that some of the rules don't *quite* work. Can be a little unbalanced towards certain players, and some of the quests could have been made a little more interesting. Would like to play again someday, though.

item.name: Hoity Toity
item.comment: One of my favourite "opener" games, as has very simple rules and is a great introduction to beginners to Euro games. Marked down slightly only because it has been played to death!

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
Khronos
item.comment: Cool little game with obvious connections to Tigris & Euphrates. Quite a brain burner and a little bit chaotic - just be glad it only goes on for seven rounds!

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: This game is badly designed - there are holes in the rules, the card interactions are unclear, and the winning condition is completely arbitrary. My disbelief that this game went through any sort of playtesting is only topped by my disbelief that it managed to spawn so many expansions!

item.name: Kremlin
item.comment: Played a couple of times and really liked it. Unfortunately the rules are quite convoluted so they're always difficult to remember from session to session and then explain to new players (even though once you start playing it becomes much easier). Will hopefully play again someday.

item.name: Landlord!
item.comment: A fun game, but with a couple of broken rules that don't make it very appealing for a serious gamer - no cap on the number of cards you can buy each turn means that the game suffers from a serious runaway leader effect. With a few slight house rule mods I would bump the rating up to a 6 or 7.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
Lord of the Rings
item.comment: I really like this game mostly because it's so completely different to anything else out there. It also feels very balanced and still unpredictable even though you're basically playing against the board itself! And if you don't like that, you can always add the Sauron expansion. Unfortunately, it takes a couple of plays to really "get" this game, so a lot of my friends are turned off after the first play and don't want to play again. *Big* pity!

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
item.comment: Neither improves nor diminishes an already excellent game - just adds more, making it different. Maybe can be a bit too easy to win with a military victory, though.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lord of the Rings: The Duel
Lucca Città
item.comment: Not my kind of game. Too abstract, too short and bad theme.

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment: Truely excellent game - such deep strategy and so many choices to make all the time. Almost no downtime for any player as everyone is always invloved at all stages of the game. The only thing I would mark it down for is the fact that you have *so* much stuff to think about and keep track of, which wouldn't usually be such a bad thing but in this case you have to repeat the same thing seven times over at least four hours. Still an excellent game though - one of the best I've ever played.

item.name: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination
Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: Very good game, but the overwhelming fiddliness of the rules makes it impossible to teach to anyone not already familiar with CCGs. Don't play it any more 'cos I don't have anyone to play it against!

item.name: Mancala
item.comment: Not a fan of abstract games, so not my sort of thing.

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Season of the Witch
Mare Nostrum
item.comment: Cool Civ game, though took me a little while to get into and even then I felt like I was consistently underperforming (contrary to what the other players were saying). Would like very much to play again to see how well my understanding progresses.

item.name: Mare Nostrum: Mythology Expansion
item.comment: Adds mythological stuff to the base game - 'nuff said. I've never played without the expansion, so I can't really compare the before and after shots.

item.name: Marvel Heroes
item.comment: Really cool game that captures the flavor of the Marvel universe well. Hoping for an expansion soon, though!

item.name: Mindbenders
item.comment: Just like Mindtrap, a bunch of riddles in a box. Unlike Mindtrap, however, the riddles range from stupidly easy to impossible to solve, with very little in between. Logic seems to be absent in almost every question. My advice if you like riddles: buy Mindtrap instead.

item.name: MindTrap
item.comment: Basically just a box of riddles. Not really my thing at all.

item.name: Mission: Red Planet
item.comment: Cool game, very similar to Citadels. Can feel like you don't have very much control over what you want to do, though.

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: I only have the Malaysian edition (from my travels - thought I should collect a Monopoly from every country I visit), but never gets played seeing as I have the far superior Stock Exchange edition.

item.name: Monopoly: Here and Now
item.comment: Only mark this one point higher than the original as at least now the place names make some kind of sense in the modern world. Still only play the far superior Stock Exchange edition, though.

item.name: Monopoly: Stock Exchange
item.comment: The best version of all Monopoli by far! The game isn't decided after the first few turns like in normal Monopoly, and the prospect of hostile takeovers keps the game uncertain. More genius on the part of Knizia!

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: Holes in the rules, unbalanced actions against your character, and difficult to keep track of your current status. The cards are funny to look at but that's about it (though not even that if you've never played D&D).

item.name: Nametrain
item.comment: Okay game, but can get a bit repetative after playing it for a while (and feels like it goes on a bit longer than it should).

item.name: Nightmare
item.comment: The DVD version improves upon this one quite a lot, so there's no point ever playing this one again. I think the original Gatekeeper was better, though.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Perikles
item.comment: Good game. A little confusing at first as there's certainly lots to think about. Not really my theme, though. Combat table is a bit hard to interpret correctly (unless you're a wargamer). Marked down due to being too unintuitive.

item.name: Portal: The Uncooperative Cake Acquisition Game
Power Grid
item.comment: Excellent game! Elegant, simple strategy and so much fun!

item.name: Prophecy
item.comment: Good fantasy adventure game which goes on for a little too long for what it is. Additional criticism of there being a *lot* of very tiny text to read on the board at any one time. Apart from that, very enjoyable, though I still prefer Runebound.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Wouldn't go so far as to say it's the greatest game of all time but still certainly very good. Maybe a groundbreaker in its day but has been copied so much now that it's difficult to see what's so amazingly special. Also spoiled by the fact that it has a very boring theme (the original sci-fi theme would have been *much* better)!

item.name: Quest for the Dragonlords
item.comment: Broken, convoluted rules and huge player downtime make this game no fun to the point of being almost unplayable. Massively over-produced as well. An epic war game which I won on the 4th round due to a fluke piece of luck I had on my very first turn. Shouldn't be allowed; I'd rather play Risk.

item.name: Quest for the DragonLords: The Crystal of Power
item.comment: Makes a bad game longer. Why?

item.name: Ra
item.comment: Excellent auction game. Another solid classic from Knizia!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Railways of the World
item.comment: Surprisingly simple yet deeply strategic train game. Well done Glenn!

item.name: The Republic of Rome
item.comment: Typical Avalon Hill game of the period - immensely fiddly. Although not a bad game as such by any means, I just couldn't wait to get away and was bored to the point of losing the will to live right from the beginning. Just *not* my cup of tea.

item.name: Return of the Heroes
item.comment: Excellent adventuring game. One or two minor problems (the broomstick is *way* too powerful, especially for a warrior bizarrely enough!) but apart from that a darn good romp. Could have done with a little more variety in the encounters, especially with the monsters.

item.name: Rex: Final Days of an Empire
Risk: Star Wars Original Trilogy Edition
RoboRally
item.comment: Love this game! Absolutely one of may favourites and cannot find fault with it. Everyone I know loves it too. Only people I wouldn't recommend it to are people who have trouble remembering their left from their right (especially if they have to inverse it relative to the direction they're facing)!

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Roll Through the Ages: The Late Bronze Age
Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: Greatly surpassed my expectations! Best described as a combination of Descent, World of Warcraft and Arkham Horror all rolled into one with the complexity turned down a notch (or two). Great fun and definitely well worth a look.

item.name: Runebound: Crown of the Elder Kings
San Juan
item.comment:
Good game, with a similar feel to Puerto Rico. The production/trading mechanic felt a little hollow at first but then grew on me as the game went on. Have a feeling I may have underestimated it, so would like to play again.
*Update*: have played again with two players (previously was with four) and it seemed much worse even though this is the game that was designed as a 2-player Puerto Rico! Have marked it down one point until can play yet *again*.

item.name: Schotten-Totten
item.comment: Nice little filler game with good strategy.

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment: Okay game, but not my sort of thing. Not really into word play.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: Excellent co-operative game. Would be interested to see how it scales (we played with five) and also how it works with a traitor.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Sin City
item.comment: I like this game, despite the negative reviews. A very simple game to learn and get into, and *much* better than most other movie tie-ins out there. With a couple of house rules thrown in (start with 3 goal cards; move *up to* the amount shown on your move cards) I would up the score to an 8.

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Smash Up: The Obligatory Cthulhu Set
Space Crusade
item.comment: I like this game, but due to the long set-up time and millions of messy (and broken) bits it doesn't see much play. Not popular with my gaming group either - has been upstaged by Doom. Oh well.

item.name: Space Dealer
item.comment: Really cool, fun game. A little frantic, though! Also good if you know you've only got 30 minutes to fill!

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
Star Trek: Customizable Card Game (first edition)
item.comment: Used to play this a *lot* when I was a teenager. Only now I realise how bad it really is. Has been improved a lot in its 2nd Edition re-implementation, but still relies a lot on memorising skill lists for each of your (and your opponent's) personnel. Dilemma resolution also involves too much reading-and-checking, too. Despite all this, the game still holds a special place in my heart (Decipher.com is still my homepage).

item.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Interactive VCR Board Game – A Klingon Challenge
item.comment: Fun little game when I was 12, but even then I could see that it was far too easy to "beat" the game and had to create my own house rules.

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game – Brood War Expansion
Starfarers of Catan
item.comment: Love empire-building games and love a science-fiction/space theme, so obviously this one would appeal to me. Only marked down by a couple of points as most of my friends don't seem to "get" it, the plastic motherships have bits that easily snap off (mine are almost completely broken now, but still playable) and it pales a little in the shadow of Twilight Imperium!

item.name: Starfarers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: Lets two more players play. 'Nuff said.

item.name: The Three Musketeers: The Queen's Pendants
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Through the Desert
item.comment: Good game, but need more players than the two that we originally played with. Also need more time to figure out the strategy of the game!

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Extremely deep and strategic game that is highly abstracted yet very well themed, especially for a Knizia game. Not *quite* my cup of tea but I can certainly appreciate it for the excellent game it is.

item.name: Time Control
item.comment: Only played once but could see that the rules were obviously in need of quite some fixing. Would like to try again with some modified rules, either my own or the ones posted here on BGG, as the theme is totally cool and I even quite like the look of some of the components (even though they were done "on the cheap").

item.name: Top Trumps
item.comment: I've always wondered what the appeal of Top Trumps is, as it's completely a luck-based game. Own the Buffy, Angel and Lord of the Rings versions just for their collectability.

item.name: Totally Dingbats
item.comment: I like this game, but have never found anyone else who did. Unfortunately, I learned the answers to all the cards when I was 11 years old and have never forgotten them (despite a ten year gap of not playing), so I can easily beat anyone I play against. I only rate the weight of this game as light/medium as almost everyone I play against finds it really hard to figure out the answers to the cards (I always found it relatively easy)!

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: Absolutely love it! Best game of all time and then some! Can't even begin to describe how great this game is so I won't even bother - terrific!

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shards of the Throne
Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shattered Empire
item.comment: More for Twilight Imperium! What could possibly be bad?

item.name: Wallenstein (first edition)
item.comment: Good game, quite similar to Diplomacy/Game of Thrones with an interesting secret player/action round mechanic. Would probably prefer the re-themed Shogun, though.

item.name: War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment: Only played once and got creamed but enjoyed every minute of it. Recreates the Lord of the Rings universe perfectly. Need to play again!

item.name: War of the Ring Collector's Edition
War of the Ring: Battles of the Third Age
Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
item.comment: Just what it says on the tin - a box of questions just like the TV show! Usually play at the end of a games night to wind down.

item.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
item.comment: Love this game! The two big points that mark this down for me, though, are the long down-time for each player and the incredibly long length of the game (I don't see how they expect one game to come in at 3 hours, and especially not with six players)! Otherwise, love it!

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – BlizzCon Epic Armor Pack
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – Shadow of War
item.comment: Adds variety to the original - a definite improvement.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – The Burning Crusade
Zombies!!!
item.comment: Extremely simple game with a very heavy luck factor. Bit dull to play, but bits are very nice to look at.
